oai_dc:dc.dc:title: THE GREAT BELT LINK HOW TO ACHIEVE ZERO ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACT ON THE BALTIC SEA
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Moller, Jacob Steen
Hansen, Niels-Erik Ottesen
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Great Belt Link
environmental impact
Baltic Sea
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Great Belt Link crosses the Great Belt (Denmark) which is the major strait connecting the Baltic Sea with the North Sea. A law passed by the Danish Parliament imposes an environmental design criteria of 'zero far field effect' on the Link. This paper describes how the challenge of zero effect is met by compensation dredging. The compensation dredging is designed by the use of highly sophisticated numerical models.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 22 (1990): Proceedings of 22nd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Delft, The Netherlands, 1990.
